org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.fsa

Class Aperiodic

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractAlgorithm
      • org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.fsa.Aperiodic
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, Algorithm, AlgorithmListener

    public class Aperiodic
extends AbstractAlgorithm

    This class provides methods to determine whether a classic finite state automaton or a Büchi automaton is aperiodic, determine whether the language recognized by the automaton is star-free. All the operations are based on [Volker Diekert, Paul Gastin: First-order definable languages. Logic and Automata, volume 2 of Texts in Logic and Games, pp. 261-306, 2008].

    Let L be a regular language. Then the followings are equivalent.

    1. L is first-order definable.
    2. L is star-free.
    3. L is aperiodic.
    4. The syntactic monoid of L (the transition monoid of the minimal deterministic automaton that recognizes L) is aperiodic.

    Let L be an ω-regular language. Then the followins are equivalent.

    1. L is first-order definable.
    2. L is star-free.
    3. L is aperiodic.
    4. L is definable in the linear-time temporal logic (LTL).
    5. There is a counter-free Büchi automaton A with L = L(A).
    6. There is an aperiodic Büchi automaton A with L = L(A).
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

      The option of skip rejected strings.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isAperiodic(FSA aut)
      Returns true if (1) the option O_TEST_AUTOMATON is enabled and a specified automaton is aperiodic or (2) the option O_TEST_AUTOMATON is disabled and the language of the specified automaton is aperiodic.
      boolean isAutomatonAperiodic(FSA aut)
      Returns true if an NFW or an NBW is aperiodic.
      boolean isLanguageAperiodic(FSA aut)
      Returns true if the language of an NFW or an NBW is aperiodic (that is, equivalently star-free).
      boolean isMonoidAperiodic(java.util.Set<Matrix<TransitionMonoid.Value>> monoid)
      Returns true if a finite monoid is aperiodic.
      boolean isRegularLanguageAperiodic(FSA aut)
      Returns true if the language of an NFW is aperiodic.

    • Field Detail

      • O_TEST_AUTOMATON

        public static final java.lang.String O_TEST_AUTOMATON
        The option of testing if an automaton is aperiodic.

      • O_AUTOMATON_APERIODIC_FIRST

        public static final java.lang.String O_AUTOMATON_APERIODIC_FIRST
        The option of testing if an automaton is aperiodic first before testing if the language of the automaton is aperiodic. If the automaton is aperiodic, then the language it recognizes is also aperiodic.

      • O_SKIP_REJECTED

        public static final java.lang.String O_SKIP_REJECTED
        The option of skip rejected strings.
